how to reinstall the grub
how to reinstall the grub in the copied filesystem
from the command line run 'sudo grub-install' it will give you command line options, you'll want to set the root to the device that is your primary (booted) harddrive. eg. /dev/hda1
grub-install --root-directory=/mnt/newpartition /dev/hda1
this only gave an err not able to read stage1
it should be 'sudo grub-install --root-directory=/dev/hda1
if that doesn't work, mount /dev/hda1 using the mount command, then re-run the command with the mounted point rather than /dev/hda1
